page.title: 04Farming in Heathylee
page.content: There are dairy and beef cows, sheep, hens, pigs and goats in Heathylee. There is a mixture of grazing, rough pasture, meadow, moorland, pasture and marsh. The land is used to keep animals intensively on the lower areas and extensively on the moorland. There is much moorland because the ground is high up and so it is wet and cold and the ground becomes covered with peat. Heather and bilberry grow on this where the drainage is good but cotton grass and rushes grow in the wetter areas. There are about 11 months winter and one month of bad weather in Heathylee: most farmers now make silage because the weather in summer often spoils the hay. Many farmers are now using big bale silage, wrapped in polythene bags.
